title: How to Stop Straws from Floating in Soft Drink Cans

steps.headline: Make sure that your can is "stay-on-tab" type, which means that the tab stays on your can after it has been opened.
steps.description: This technique will only work on such cans.

steps.headline: Open your can.
steps.description: Do not use too much force or else the tab could be broken or detached.

steps.headline: Turn the tab so that it lies over the can mouth.
Insert the straw through the tab ring.
Turn the tab either to the left or to the right until there is friction between the straw and the edge of can mouth.

text: Make sure that your can is "stay-on-tab" type, which means that the tab stays on your can after it has been opened. This technique will only work on such cans. Open your can. Do not use too much force or else the tab could be broken or detached. Turn the tab so that it lies over the can mouth.  Insert the straw through the tab ring.  Turn the tab either to the left or to the right until there is friction between the straw and the edge of can mouth.
